values.label: Dialectal Variant
values.description: A regional or social variety of a language.

values.label: Free Variant
values.description: Interchangeable forms used by the same speaker without discernible conditioning.

values.label: Irregularly Inflected Form
values.description: Forms that deviate from standard rules, such as 'men' for the plural of 'man'.

values.label: Spelling Variant
values.description: Purely orthographic differences (e.g., color vs. colour).

values.label: Compound
values.description: A word formed from two or more stems.

values.label: Derivative
values.description: A stem that is made up of a root plus an affix that adds a non-inflectional component of meaning.

values.label: Idiom
values.description: A multi-word expression that is recognized as a semantic unit.

values.label: Phrasal Verb
values.description: A combination of a lexical verb and a verbal particle that forms a single semantic and syntactic unit.

values.label: Contraction
values.description: A combination of two lexemes that are phonologically reduced.

values.label: Saying
values.description: Any pithy phrasal expression of wisdom or truth; esp., an adage, proverb, or maxim.

is-primary.label: Is primary (trait)
is-primary.description: Marks a component as primary in complex forms
